title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A classic novel depicting the glamour and excess of the Jazz Age.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A novel set in the American Deep South that addresses issues of racism and social injustice.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian novel exploring themes of totalitarianism and government surveillance.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A romantic novel following the love story of Elizabeth Bennet and Mr. Darcy.

title: Moby-Dick
author: Herman Melville
description: A novel about the obsessive quest of Captain Ahab to hunt down the white whale Moby Dick.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: A coming-of-age novel following the journey of Holden Caulfield in New York City.

title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
author: Gabriel Garcia Marquez
description: A novel depicting the multi-generational story of the Buendia family in Macondo.

title: The Lord of the Rings
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: An epic high-fantasy novel chronicling the quest to destroy the One Ring.

title: Crime and Punishment
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: A psychological novel exploring the mental anguish and moral dilemmas of Raskolnikov.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: A fantasy novel about the journey of Bilbo Baggins and his quest to reclaim treasure.

title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
author: Oscar Wilde
description: A novel exploring the corrupting influence of hedonism and aestheticism.

title: Frankenstein
author: Mary Shelley
description: A Gothic science fiction novel depicting the creation of a monster.

title: Alice's Adventures in Wonderland
author: Lewis Carroll
description: A fantasy novel about a young girl's adventures in a magical world.

title: The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn
author: Mark Twain
description: A novel following the journey of Huck Finn and Jim down the Mississippi River.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: A dystopian novel exploring a futuristic society's dark and oppressive aspects.

title: The Scarlet Letter
author: Nathaniel Hawthorne
description: A novel set in 17th-century Puritan Boston, exploring themes of sin and redemption.

title: The Brothers Karamazov
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: A philosophical novel delving into the moral struggles and relationships of the Karamazov family.

title: The War of the Worlds
author: H.G. Wells
description: A science fiction novel depicting an alien invasion of Earth.
